title: What's the name of this font? Anyone?
content:
I was hoping someone could help me with a quick ID of the font used in the attached JPG.

Thanks!

Regards  
Phileas

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font\_query.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905124814/http:/typophile.com/files/font_query.jpg) | 40.36 KB |

 [‹ Type ID please :D](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905124814/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44839 "Go to previous forum topic") [Does anyone know this font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905124814/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44840 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Phileas

comments.content: I’d say this is (Monotype) Apollo by Adrian Frutiger. The image is rather unsharp but the fact that the sample uses old-style figures and small-caps and that Apollo is available with those gives me some extra confidence ;)

Hi Lars

I don’t think that it’s Apollo, I will just have to keep looking....

Thanks for the effort Lars!

Regards  
Phileas

I think it is [TheSerif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905124814/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/lucasfonts/theserif_classic/) designed by [Luc(as) de Groot](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905124814/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Luc%252528as%252529%252Bde%252BGroot).
Hi Phileas: this looks like Luc(as) de Groot’s [TheSerif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905124814/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/cgi-bin/loadframe/lucasfnt/theserif/serif-.html).

First Jan, now you Akira? What’s up with this synchronized posting!? :^D

Too late, Antonio. ;^P

Hi guys

TheSerif it is!

Thanks to all of you!

Over&Out  
Phileas
